intro: Oxalis quadriglandula, commonly known as the four-veined wood sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It features heart-shaped leaves with four prominent veins, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its stems are often hairy and can grow up to 1 meter in height. Oxalis quadriglandula is adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
